siteMetadata.title: HPCCSystems Solutions Lab
siteMetadata.description: HPCC Systems is a mature platform that has been heavily used in commercial applications for almost two decades, predating the development of Hadoop. Created by LexisNexis Risk Solutions, an innovative pioneer in big data processing, and open source for nearly a decade now, HPCC Systems features a vibrant development community that continues to push the boundaries of big data.

children.value: TheÂ join function produces a result dataset based on the intersection of two datasets or indexes.
The name by which the join will be invoked
multiple conditions can exists using AND/OR
Please see below Conditions for additional information
Please see below Transform for additional information
Please see below Join Types for available types
Please see below Flags for additional information
Normally contains at least one equality test
Reference attributes within the input datasets via LEFT and RIGHT - ds1 = LEFT - ds2 = RIGHT
If using an explicit TRANSFORM, it should accept at least two arguments
One representing a LEFT record and the other representing a RIGHT record
Ex: BazRec MakeBaz(FooRec rec1, BarRec rec2) := TRANSFORM â¦ END;
If using an inline TRANSFORM, use LEFT and RIGHT to reference input data
Optional flags that can alter the behavior of the JOIN. Followings are the commonly used flags
dataset is relatively small and there should be only
dataset is relatively small and can be copied to every node in its entirety
Supports join conditions that contain no equalities
Required if there are no equality tests in the condition
dataset has few records, so little memory is used

Performs the JOIN without dynamically sorting the tables. This implies that the left and/or right recordset must have been previously sorted and partitioned based on the fields specified in the joinCondition
Specifies using indexed access into the
JOIN performed on each supercomputer node independently, and maintains the pervious distribution of data
Specifies the maximum number of matching records (n) to generate into the result set. If omitted, all matches are kept.
Specifies a maximum number of matching records which, if exceeded, either fails the job, or eliminates all those matches from the result set.
: Keep only those records that exist in both datasets. Default value if no type is listed.
Keep all records from LEFT, even if there are no matches.
Keep all records from RIGHT, even if there are no matches.
One record for each left record with no match in the right.
One record for each left record with no match in the left.
One record for each left and right record with no match in the opposite.
One record for each record in left and right dataset.
